subject: Fix build error with %suse_version
commitMessage:
Fix build error with %suse_version

Tizen now have %suse_version macro defined. Delete parts of spec file that were
unused due to suse_version macro.

Change-Id: Ic3732f919c480c9fd6dea908d421409ac7aa4a5d
Signed-off-by: Yury Usishchev <y.usishchev@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

It builds successfully with the patch (https://build.tizen.org/package/show?package=icecream&project=devel%3Aarm_toolchain%3AMobile%3ABase)

Patch Set 1:

I think we have many %suse_version macro because our build system is based on suse's one.
Do we need to remove all of the suse_version macro if defined it in the package?

What package is exactly affected by the suse_version?

Patch Set 1:

There is about 10 packages that uses suse_version in spec files but only one failed. So I guess we dont need to delete each use of the macro.
List of packages:
bmap-tools
hplip
icecream
kickstarter
mic
python-pygments
qemu
rpm
rpmlint
ruby
zypper
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Counting on the +1s
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

commitMessage:

Signed-off-by: Dong Junfeng <junfeng.dong@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

rpmlint checked packaging/icecream.spec: 4 errors, 3 warnings.
- W: non-standard-group Development/Tools/Building
- line 9: E: prereq-use %fillup_prereq
- line 30: E: prereq-use %insserv_prereq
- line 32: E: prereq-use /usr/sbin/useradd /usr/sbin/groupadd
- line 44: W: non-standard-group Development/Tools/Building
- E: lib-package-without-%mklibname
- line 77: W: mixed-use-of-spaces-and-tabs (spaces: line 22, tab: line 77)

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        succeeded      

 standard       x86_64         succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded
Patch Set 1: Verified
Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
